trans-unit.source: Using Linear Regression in Machine Learning | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Using Linear Regression in Machine Learning | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: A comparison of linear regression models in Excel and in Azure Machine Learning Studio
trans-unit.target: A comparison of linear regression models in Excel and in Azure Machine Learning Studio

trans-unit.source: Using linear regression in Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: Using linear regression in Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: *Kate Baroni* and *Ben Boatman* are enterprise solution architects in Microsoft’s Data Insights Center of Excellence.
trans-unit.target: *Kate Baroni* and *Ben Boatman* are enterprise solution architects in Microsoft’s Data Insights Center of Excellence.

trans-unit.source: In this article, they describe their experience migrating an existing regression analysis suite to a cloud-based solution using Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: In this article, they describe their experience migrating an existing regression analysis suite to a cloud-based solution using Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: Our project started with two goals in mind:
trans-unit.target: Our project started with two goals in mind:

trans-unit.source: Use predictive analytics to improve the accuracy of our organization’s monthly revenue projections
trans-unit.target: Use predictive analytics to improve the accuracy of our organization’s monthly revenue projections

trans-unit.source: Use Azure ML to confirm, optimize, increase velocity, and scale of our results.
trans-unit.target: Use Azure ML to confirm, optimize, increase velocity, and scale of our results.

trans-unit.source: Like many businesses, our organization goes through a monthly revenue forecasting process.
trans-unit.target: Like many businesses, our organization goes through a monthly revenue forecasting process.

trans-unit.source: Our small team of business analysts was tasked with using Machine Learning to support the process and improve forecast accuracy.
trans-unit.target: Our small team of business analysts was tasked with using Machine Learning to support the process and improve forecast accuracy.

trans-unit.source: The team spent several months collecting data from multiple sources and running the data attributes through statistical analysis identifying key attributes relevant to services sales forecasting.
trans-unit.target: The team spent several months collecting data from multiple sources and running the data attributes through statistical analysis identifying key attributes relevant to services sales forecasting.

trans-unit.source: Next steps was to begin prototyping statistical regression models on the data in Excel.
trans-unit.target: Next steps was to begin prototyping statistical regression models on the data in Excel.

trans-unit.source: Within a few weeks we had an Excel regression model that was outperforming the current field and finance forecasting processes.
trans-unit.target: Within a few weeks we had an Excel regression model that was outperforming the current field and finance forecasting processes.

trans-unit.source: This became the baseline prediction result.
trans-unit.target: This became the baseline prediction result.

trans-unit.source: We then took the next step to moving our predictive analytics over to Azure ML to find out how Azure ML could improve on predictive performance.
trans-unit.target: We then took the next step to moving our predictive analytics over to Azure ML to find out how Azure ML could improve on predictive performance.

trans-unit.source: Our first priority was to achieve parity between Azure ML and Excel regression models.
trans-unit.target: Our first priority was to achieve parity between Azure ML and Excel regression models.

trans-unit.source: Given the exact same data, and the same split for training and testing data we wanted to achieve predictive performance parity between Excel and Azure ML.
trans-unit.target: Given the exact same data, and the same split for training and testing data we wanted to achieve predictive performance parity between Excel and Azure ML.

trans-unit.source: The Excel model outperformed the Azure ML model.
trans-unit.target: The Excel model outperformed the Azure ML model.

trans-unit.source: The failure was due to a lack of understanding of the base tool setting in Azure ML.
trans-unit.target: The failure was due to a lack of understanding of the base tool setting in Azure ML.

trans-unit.source: After a sync with the Azure ML product team, we gained a better understanding of the base setting required for our data sets, and achieved parity between the two models.
trans-unit.target: After a sync with the Azure ML product team, we gained a better understanding of the base setting required for our data sets, and achieved parity between the two models.

trans-unit.source: Our Excel Regression used the standard linear regression model found in the Excel Analysis ToolPak.
trans-unit.target: Our Excel Regression used the standard linear regression model found in the Excel Analysis ToolPak.

trans-unit.source: We calculated *Mean Absolute % Error* and used it as the performance measure for the model.
trans-unit.target: We calculated *Mean Absolute % Error* and used it as the performance measure for the model.

trans-unit.source: It took 3 months to arrive at a working model using Excel.
trans-unit.target: It took 3 months to arrive at a working model using Excel.

trans-unit.source: We brought much of the learning into the Azure ML experiment which ultimately was beneficial in understanding requirements.
trans-unit.target: We brought much of the learning into the Azure ML experiment which ultimately was beneficial in understanding requirements.

trans-unit.source: Create comparable experiment in Azure Machine Learning
trans-unit.target: Create comparable experiment in Azure Machine Learning

trans-unit.source: We followed these steps to create our experiment in Azure ML:
trans-unit.target: We followed these steps to create our experiment in Azure ML:

trans-unit.source: Uploaded the dataset as a csv file to Azure ML (very small file)
trans-unit.target: Uploaded the dataset as a csv file to Azure ML (very small file)

trans-unit.source: Created a new experiment and used the [Project Columns][project-columns] module to select the same data features used in Excel
trans-unit.target: Created a new experiment and used the [Project Columns][project-columns] module to select the same data features used in Excel

trans-unit.source: Used the [Split][split] module (with *Relative Expression* mode) to divide the data into exact same train sets as had been done in Excel
trans-unit.target: Used the [Split][split] module (with *Relative Expression* mode) to divide the data into exact same train sets as had been done in Excel

trans-unit.source: Experimented with the [Linear Regression][linear-regression] module (default options only), documented, and compared the results to our Excel regression model
trans-unit.target: Experimented with the [Linear Regression][linear-regression] module (default options only), documented, and compared the results to our Excel regression model

trans-unit.source: At first, the Excel model clearly outperformed the Azure ML model:
trans-unit.target: At first, the Excel model clearly outperformed the Azure ML model:

trans-unit.source: When we ran our process and results by the developers and data scientists on the Azure ML team, they quickly provided some useful tips.
trans-unit.target: When we ran our process and results by the developers and data scientists on the Azure ML team, they quickly provided some useful tips.

trans-unit.source: When you use the [Linear Regression][linear-regression] module in Azure ML, two methods are provided:
trans-unit.target: When you use the [Linear Regression][linear-regression] module in Azure ML, two methods are provided:

trans-unit.source: Online Gradient Descent: May be more suitable for larger-scale problems
trans-unit.target: Online Gradient Descent: May be more suitable for larger-scale problems

trans-unit.source: Ordinary Least Squares: This is the method most people think of when they hear linear regression.
trans-unit.target: Ordinary Least Squares: This is the method most people think of when they hear linear regression.

trans-unit.source: For small datasets, Ordinary Least Squares can be a more optimal choice.
trans-unit.target: For small datasets, Ordinary Least Squares can be a more optimal choice.

trans-unit.source: Consider tweaking the L2 Regularization Weight parameter to improve performance.
trans-unit.target: Consider tweaking the L2 Regularization Weight parameter to improve performance.

trans-unit.source: It is set to 0.001 by default and for our small data set, we set it to 0.005 to improve performance.
trans-unit.target: It is set to 0.001 by default and for our small data set, we set it to 0.005 to improve performance.

trans-unit.source: When we applied the recommendations, we achieved the same baseline performance in Azure ML as with Excel:
trans-unit.target: When we applied the recommendations, we achieved the same baseline performance in Azure ML as with Excel:

trans-unit.source: Excel trained on the first 18 rows, tested on the last 8 rows.
trans-unit.target: Excel trained on the first 18 rows, tested on the last 8 rows.

trans-unit.source: Excel regression formula applied to the last 8 rows
trans-unit.target: Excel regression formula applied to the last 8 rows

trans-unit.source: In addition, the Excel coefficients compared well to the feature weights in the Azure trained model:
trans-unit.target: In addition, the Excel coefficients compared well to the feature weights in the Azure trained model:

trans-unit.source: We wanted to consume Azure ML web service within Excel.
trans-unit.target: We wanted to consume Azure ML web service within Excel.

trans-unit.source: Our business analysts rely on Excel and we needed a way to call the Azure ML web service with a row of Excel data and have it return the predicted value to Excel.
trans-unit.target: Our business analysts rely on Excel and we needed a way to call the Azure ML web service with a row of Excel data and have it return the predicted value to Excel.

trans-unit.source: We also wanted to optimize our model, using the options and algorithms available in Azure ML.
trans-unit.target: We also wanted to optimize our model, using the options and algorithms available in Azure ML.

trans-unit.source: Our solution was to operationalize our Azure ML regression model by creating a web service from the trained model.
trans-unit.target: Our solution was to operationalize our Azure ML regression model by creating a web service from the trained model.

trans-unit.source: Within a few minutes, the web service was created and we could call it directly from Excel to return a predicted revenue value.
trans-unit.target: Within a few minutes, the web service was created and we could call it directly from Excel to return a predicted revenue value.

trans-unit.source: The *Web Services Dashboard* section includes a downloadable Excel workbook.
trans-unit.target: The *Web Services Dashboard* section includes a downloadable Excel workbook.

trans-unit.source: The workbook comes pre-formatted with the web service API and schema information embedded.
trans-unit.target: The workbook comes pre-formatted with the web service API and schema information embedded.

trans-unit.source: When you click on *Download Excel Workbook*, it opens and you can save it to your local computer.
trans-unit.target: When you click on *Download Excel Workbook*, it opens and you can save it to your local computer.

trans-unit.source: With the workbook open, copy your predefined parameters into the blue Parameter section as shown below.
trans-unit.target: With the workbook open, copy your predefined parameters into the blue Parameter section as shown below.

trans-unit.source: Once the parameters are entered, Excel calls out to the AzureML web service and the predicted scored labels will display in the green Predicted Values section.
trans-unit.target: Once the parameters are entered, Excel calls out to the AzureML web service and the predicted scored labels will display in the green Predicted Values section.

trans-unit.source: The workbook will continue to create predictions for parameters based on your trained model for all row items entered under Parameters.
trans-unit.target: The workbook will continue to create predictions for parameters based on your trained model for all row items entered under Parameters.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how to use this feature, see [Consuming an Azure Machine Learning Web Service from Excel](machine-learning-consuming-from-excel.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on how to use this feature, see [Consuming an Azure Machine Learning Web Service from Excel](machine-learning-consuming-from-excel.md).

trans-unit.source: Now that we had a baseline with our Excel model, we moved ahead to optimize our Azure ML Linear Regression Model.
trans-unit.target: Now that we had a baseline with our Excel model, we moved ahead to optimize our Azure ML Linear Regression Model.

trans-unit.source: We used the module [Filter-Based Feature Selection][filter-based-feature-selection] to improve on our selection of initial data elements and it helped us achieve a performance improvement of 4.6% Mean Absolute Error.
trans-unit.target: We used the module [Filter-Based Feature Selection][filter-based-feature-selection] to improve on our selection of initial data elements and it helped us achieve a performance improvement of 4.6% Mean Absolute Error.

trans-unit.source: For future projects we will use this feature which could save us weeks in iterating through data attributes to find the right set of features to use for modelling.
trans-unit.target: For future projects we will use this feature which could save us weeks in iterating through data attributes to find the right set of features to use for modelling.

trans-unit.source: Next we plan to include additional algorithms like [Bayesian][bayesian-linear-regression] or [Boosted Decision Trees][boosted-decision-tree-regression] in our experiment to compare performance.
trans-unit.target: Next we plan to include additional algorithms like [Bayesian][bayesian-linear-regression] or [Boosted Decision Trees][boosted-decision-tree-regression] in our experiment to compare performance.

trans-unit.source: If you want to experiment with regression, a good dataset to try is the Energy Efficiency Regression sample dataset, which has lots of numerical attributes.
trans-unit.target: If you want to experiment with regression, a good dataset to try is the Energy Efficiency Regression sample dataset, which has lots of numerical attributes.

trans-unit.source: The dataset is provided as part of the sample datasets in ML Studio.
trans-unit.target: The dataset is provided as part of the sample datasets in ML Studio.

trans-unit.source: You can use a variety of learning modules to predict either Heating Load or Cooling Load.
trans-unit.target: You can use a variety of learning modules to predict either Heating Load or Cooling Load.

trans-unit.source: The chart below is a performance comparison of different regression learns against the Energy Efficiency dataset predicting for the target variable Cooling Load:
trans-unit.target: The chart below is a performance comparison of different regression learns against the Energy Efficiency dataset predicting for the target variable Cooling Load:

trans-unit.source: We learned a lot by from running Excel regression and Azure Machine Learning experiments in parallel.
trans-unit.target: We learned a lot by from running Excel regression and Azure Machine Learning experiments in parallel.

trans-unit.source: Creating the baseline model in Excel and comparing it to models using Azure ML [Linear Regression][linear-regression] helped us learn Azure ML, and we discovered opportunities to improve data selection and model performance.
trans-unit.target: Creating the baseline model in Excel and comparing it to models using Azure ML [Linear Regression][linear-regression] helped us learn Azure ML, and we discovered opportunities to improve data selection and model performance.

trans-unit.source: We also found that it is advisable to use [Filter-Based Feature Selection][filter-based-feature-selection] to accelerate future prediction projects.
trans-unit.target: We also found that it is advisable to use [Filter-Based Feature Selection][filter-based-feature-selection] to accelerate future prediction projects.

trans-unit.source: By applying feature selection to your data, you can create an improved model in Azure ML with better overall performance.
trans-unit.target: By applying feature selection to your data, you can create an improved model in Azure ML with better overall performance.

trans-unit.source: The ability to transfer the predictive analytic forecasting from Azure ML to Excel systemically allows a significant increase in the ability to successfully provide results to a broad business user audience.
trans-unit.target: The ability to transfer the predictive analytic forecasting from Azure ML to Excel systemically allows a significant increase in the ability to successfully provide results to a broad business user audience.

trans-unit.source: Some resources are listed for helping you work with regression:
trans-unit.target: Some resources are listed for helping you work with regression:

trans-unit.source: If you’ve never tried regression in Excel, this tutorial makes it easy: [http://www.excel-easy.com/examples/regression.html](http://www.excel-easy.com/examples/regression.html)
trans-unit.target: If you’ve never tried regression in Excel, this tutorial makes it easy: [http://www.excel-easy.com/examples/regression.html](http://www.excel-easy.com/examples/regression.html)

trans-unit.source: Tyler Chessman wrote a blog article explaining how to do time series forecasting in Excel, which contains a good beginner’s description of linear regression.
trans-unit.target: Tyler Chessman wrote a blog article explaining how to do time series forecasting in Excel, which contains a good beginner’s description of linear regression.

trans-unit.source: Ordinary Least Squares Linear Regression: Flaws, Problems and Pitfalls.
trans-unit.target: Ordinary Least Squares Linear Regression: Flaws, Problems and Pitfalls.

trans-unit.source: For an introduction and discussion of Regression: [http://www.clockbackward.com/2009/06/18/ordinary-least-squares-linear-regression-flaws-problems-and-pitfalls/ ](http://www.clockbackward.com/2009/06/18/ordinary-least-squares-linear-regression-flaws-problems-and-pitfalls/ )
trans-unit.target: For an introduction and discussion of Regression: [http://www.clockbackward.com/2009/06/18/ordinary-least-squares-linear-regression-flaws-problems-and-pitfalls/ ](http://www.clockbackward.com/2009/06/18/ordinary-least-squares-linear-regression-flaws-problems-and-pitfalls/ )
